intro: Denhamia ferdinandi, commonly known as the slender denhamia, is a species of flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the family Myrtaceae, which includes eucalyptus and tea tree species. The plant is characterized by its small, narrow leaves and clusters of white or pink flowers that bloom in spring. It typically grows in sandy or rocky soils in coastal areas. Denhamia ferdinandi is often found in heathlands and is adapted to withstand dry conditions.
